alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 6:46AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL FRANKLIN, NORTHERN FAIRFIELD AND SOUTHERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 715 AM EDT... At 645 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Summit Station to Reynoldsburg to Bexley, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, penny size hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Newark, Reynoldsburg, Gahanna, Pickerington, Bexley, Heath, Granville, Pataskala, Baltimore, Buckeye Lake, Hebron, Millersport, Pleasantville, Harbor Hills, Granville South, Fairfield Beach, Beechwood Trails, Summit Station and Thornport. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 102 and 142, and near mile marker 144. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
